messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:41): ARGH!

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:01): oh, damn. running Windows in VMWare on Mac, going to http://localhost/ doesn't see the server running on the Mac, it tries to find the server running on Windows. :-(
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (21:03): ipconfig /all in a terminal, look at the IP for 'default gateway', and point the browser at that
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:04): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Change the network type
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:08): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: IIRC, if you go to Settings -> Network (on the VM) one of the options should make localhost the host
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:08): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98, re http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20080515#l-1206 - did you get a chance to follow up on that?
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (21:10): not yet; work's been pretty crazy
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (21:11): hoping to take a look at it this weekend
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:12): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, none of the prefs in there seem to help
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:18): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: You could use your real machine rather than a VM
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (21:24): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, I need to use the windows build because we don't have a suitable mac build that supports video
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:24): Oh, how annoying - I can easily make charsUntil ten times faster on my artifical test case, but it makes about zero different in practice :-(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:25): *difference

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:29): ...and when parsing the spec (with parse.py --no-html), inputStream.py is only about 30% of the total execution time anyway, so there's little room for global improvement anyway
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:31): gives up instead
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:34): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: That's why I was trying with the spec. That's not so artificial.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:34): Actually I'm cheating and testing with the first 1K or 10K lines of the spec, since I'm lazy
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:35): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: parser.parse() with the lxml etree builder makes charsUntil 70% of the total time
6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30 (21:39): Hi there!
6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30 (21:40): Does Web Applications 1.0 either directly or indirectly refer to the Selectors API or XmlHttpRequest of the W3C Web API WG?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:41): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: When I run parse.py --profile --no-html --treebuilder=lxml on the first 10K lines of the spec, it spends cumtime=0.819 out of total 5.982 in charsUntil
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:42): (and 1.507 in total in inputstream.py, vs 2.116 in tokenizer.py and 1.019 in html5parser.py)
6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30 (21:43): This Colloquy sort of IRC Client is strange :(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:43): 6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30: It does
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:43): 6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30: e.g. http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/section-origin.html has an [XHR] reference
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:44): 6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30: (Doesn't refer to the Selectors API as far as I can see, though)
6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30 (21:45): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: thanks! :)
6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30 (21:45): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I'm writing a thesis about HTML 5 and was wondering, if the Selectors API is something seperate
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:46): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: That's totally different to what I get from cProfile‚Ä¶
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:46): 6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30: I think the only relation is that similar people are working on both
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:46): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: 5.214 out of 17.312 using python parse.py --no-html --profile --treebuilder=lxml ../../html5
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:47): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: (that's on an entire several month old .src.html copy of html5)
6cba5ee1cbe5c1742070b04dd14dac30 (21:47): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: you mean those pragmatic, we do whats necessary sorts of people? ;)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:49): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Whoops, I was using my modified inputstream.py... With the original it's more like 1.542 out of 6.628 in charsUntil
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:49): but that's still only ~25%
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:49): Oh, which is not much different to what you saw
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:49): (but is quite different to 70%)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:50): I got 70% from cProfile

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:51): Even cutting execution time by 70% wouldn't make html5lib significantly faster, compared to the orders of magnitude from writing the whole thing in Java/C/etc
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:52): gets depressed and goes home
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:52): Sure, but some of us don't know Java/C :P
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:52): That's why you start collecting vast amounts of money to encourage a Java/C programmer to write it for you
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:53): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Or I just learn C :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:54): HTTP is _so_ odd.
